column5: I was thinking about taking the young lad out on Simcoe this Saturday.But have never fished the lake when it wasn't frozen.I dont even have a clue where to launch my boat.Anybody else heading out this weekend? I was thinking Cooks Bay area maybe for some pike fun.Can any body help me out even if its just with a boat launch with a good dock and good parking?It does not have to be a free launch because I don't mind paying for the use of a quality boat ramp. Thanks in advance Dan

I see your from Burlington so I assume you are talking west side of cooks bay.  Free launch at the end of HWY 89. If you want to Launch at a marina off 89 make a right on Hwy 11 then first Left and follow that to the water.  I think the Marina is called Cook's Bay Marina.  Better launch at the end of Innisfil Rd in the park but $30 for non residents.  Also you can launch in the Holland River off of Queenston and a few other places.  Hope this helps, good luck fishing with the new boat.

I don't know of any on the west side I use a ramp on the east side, but it's not very good, the last couple of times I had to jump in the water to get the boat on because of low water..... but the first one on the west  side is  http://www.cooksbaymarina.com/map.htm
monte reno marina,  its a good launch dont think it cost all that much.
I wonder if my Garmin gps comes loaded with all the boat ramps?

If you want the kid to have a blast and catch all day long,the perch are here in the bay plentiful along with some smallie action. The young one will have a blast along with yourself. Theres also a free launch here. PM If you want more info.

I'll be out tomorrow morning aswell slamming big pike,   the last 3 weeks have been awesome for me but just beaware it will be a war zone in the south end tomorrow morning due to duck hunting, Good luck......
TPH were are you launching tomorrow.Due you have a vhf on board maybe we can chat in the morning
Keswick is where I launch and I Kayak fish so no vhf radio
